featured.text: He was trapped inside as the boat was driven under the water.
Furthermore, elephants are known to resist leaving their sick or dying behind, and a herd may linger at a trench with a trapped baby for hours, reluctant to move on until all hope is lost.
When mothers try to dig their babies out, both may be trapped and smothered by thick mud.

other.text: The trenches, however, can be death traps for the elephants.
They are trapped by the sharp branches of the tea trees.
Dallas County was not doing some of the key things to slow the spread of West Nile, such as testing dead birds and setting mosquito traps to test for the presence of the disease.

definition.en_def: A device or situation designed to catch or deceive someone.
definition.example: The hunter set a trap to catch the rabbit.
